docstr: `C_SIZEOF` â€” Size in bytes of an expression ### Description `C_SIZEOF(X)` calculates the number of bytes of storage the expression `X` occupies. ### Syntax `N = C_SIZEOF(X)` ### Arguments | `X` | The argument shall be an interoperable data entity. ### Return value The return value is of type integer and of the system-dependent kind `C_SIZE_T` (from the `ISO_C_BINDING` module). Its value is the number of bytes occupied by the argument. If the argument has the `POINTER` attribute, the number of bytes of the storage area pointed to is returned. If the argument is of a derived type with `POINTER`or `ALLOCATABLE` components, the return value does not account for the sizes of the data pointed to by these components. ### Example ``` use iso_c_binding integer(c_int) :: i real(c_float) :: r, s(5) print *, (c_sizeof(s)/c_sizeof(r) == 5) end ``` The example will print `.TRUE.` unless you are using a platform where default `REAL` variables are unusually padded. ### Standard Fortran 2008 ### Class Inquiry function of the module `ISO_C_BINDING` ### See also SIZEOF, STORAGE_SIZE
